trans-unit.source: How to: Set Security and Authentication on a Service Bus Application
trans-unit.target: How to: Set Security and Authentication on a Service Bus Application

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses how to authenticate a service and client application using <token>sb1</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses how to authenticate a service and client application using <token>sb1</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> setting transport and message-level security, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>, and also the <link xlink:href="f0ecc6f7-f4b5-42a4-9cb1-b02e28e26620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing Services</link> topic in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> setting transport and message-level security, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>, and also the <link xlink:href="f0ecc6f7-f4b5-42a4-9cb1-b02e28e26620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing Services</link> topic in the <token>indigo1</token> documentation.

trans-unit.source: If you are developing a service, you must first determine what type of credentials you will use to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>, and whether a client that connects to your service must authenticate.
trans-unit.target: If you are developing a service, you must first determine what type of credentials you will use to authenticate with <token>sb2</token>, and whether a client that connects to your service must authenticate.

trans-unit.source: All services are required to authenticate with the <token>sb2</token>, using SAML, a shared secret, a simple Web token, or a Shared Access Signature (SAS) token.
trans-unit.target: All services are required to authenticate with the <token>sb2</token>, using SAML, a shared secret, a simple Web token, or a Shared Access Signature (SAS) token.

trans-unit.source: You may decide to have a different form of authentication for your service as you do for the client.
trans-unit.target: You may decide to have a different form of authentication for your service as you do for the client.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="9790edea-0930-4f53-8d6a-b5e30fc3655d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Choosing Authentication for an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="9790edea-0930-4f53-8d6a-b5e30fc3655d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Choosing Authentication for an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are developing a client, determine what type of authentication credentials are required by the service to which you are connecting.
trans-unit.target: If you are developing a client, determine what type of authentication credentials are required by the service to which you are connecting.

trans-unit.source: This can be done in a variety of ways.
trans-unit.target: This can be done in a variety of ways.

trans-unit.source: This includes retrieving the information from the contract metadata.
trans-unit.target: This includes retrieving the information from the contract metadata.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="0451f22f-aab0-4e5c-b76c-25c4264be242" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design an AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: To set Service Bus authentication with an App.config file
trans-unit.target: To set Service Bus authentication with an App.config file

trans-unit.source: Define a behavior that contains the specified <codeInline>%%amp;lt;transportClientEndpointBehavior%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element, and also the relevant credentials.
trans-unit.target: Define a behavior that contains the specified <codeInline>%%amp;lt;transportClientEndpointBehavior%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element, and also the relevant credentials.

trans-unit.source: The following code, from the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp sample</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink>, shows how to declare and configure a shared secret credential.
trans-unit.target: The following code, from the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp sample</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink>, shows how to declare and configure a shared secret credential.

trans-unit.source: In this procedure, the issuer name and secret are held directly in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: In this procedure, the issuer name and secret are held directly in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you implement some form of security on any configuration file that contains such security information.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you implement some form of security on any configuration file that contains such security information.

trans-unit.source: Once you have defined the credentials in the App.config file, the application will use the security configuration automatically.
trans-unit.target: Once you have defined the credentials in the App.config file, the application will use the security configuration automatically.

trans-unit.source: There are no additional steps necessary.
trans-unit.target: There are no additional steps necessary.

trans-unit.target: As is common in <token>sb2</token> samples, this procedure uses a SAS policy name and key, and they are typed in directly.

trans-unit.source: Once you have applied the credentials to the channel factory, you can open a connection to the endpoint and access <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Once you have applied the credentials to the channel factory, you can open a connection to the endpoint and access <token>sb2</token>.
